radiographic_examinations.findings: Diffuse interstitial opacities, consistent with interstitial edema; mild cardiac enlargement; aortic atherosclerosis.

radiographic_examinations.procedure_name: CT scan of the abdomen and pelvis without intravenous contrast material
radiographic_examinations.findings: Atelectasis in both lung bases; small calcified nodules in the right lower lung; a nodule (3 mm in diameter) in the lingula; free-flowing ascites throughout the abdomen, surrounding the liver and spleen, and in the paracolic gutters and cul-de-sac; a lytic lesion in the fifth lumbar vertebral body.
A lytic destructive process in the sternum with a soft-tissue mass anteriorly; tree-in-bud opacities in the upper lobe of the left lung.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: The mass over the sternum enlarged during the first 2 months of therapy and then eventually decompressed spontaneously.
